summary.title: encoders
summary.content:
Sure, here is a summary of the topic:

The topic discusses positional encodings in both the encoder and decoder stacks of a transformer model. 

Key points:

* The base model uses a rate of Pdrop = 0.1 and employs label smoothing with a value of Ïµls = 0.1.
* The big transformer model outperforms previously reported models by 2.0 BLEU on the WMT 2014 English-to-German translation task.
* The model uses multi-head attention in three different ways: encoder-decoder attention, self-attention, and scaled dot-product attention.
* The model also contains a fully connected feed-forward network for each layer in both the encoder and decoder.
* The model is trained on the WMT 2014 English-to-German and English-to-French translation tasks.

summary.title: decoders
summary.content:
Sure, here is a summary of the topic:

The encoder is a sub-model responsible for extracting context from the input sequence. It consists of self-attention layers and a feed-forward network.

The decoder is a sub-model that attends to all positions in the input sequence, preventing leftward information flow. It also consists of self-attention layers and a feed-forward network.

Both the encoder and decoder use multi-head attention to allow each position in the sequence to attend to all other positions.

The attention function is used in both the encoder and decoder to capture relationships between different positions in the sequence.
